intro: Junellia dolichothyrsa, commonly known as the long-throated junellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Junellia dolichothyrsa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
